reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solved some common problems
reviews.reviewText: So, I had an old Logitech 720p camera and wanted something better for video conferencing during the shelter-in-place. When I installed the Hrayzan, I had both video AND audio problems. Read through all the Q&A and reviews and didn't find an answer that would work. AUDIO: It turned out somehow the microphone had gotten muted. Just opened the Sound Settings (right click on the sound icon) and ran the Troubleshooter. It un-muted the microphone and haven't had a problem since. VIDEO: The picture was great but I was getting a jumping garbled picture that was fairly random. After almost tearing out what little hair I have left, I finally just tried a different USB port and the problem instantly went away. Now the picture is perfect. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars on picture quality is because of the fish-eye distortion around the corners of the picture. But, I guess that is reasonable with the wide field of vision this camera provides. I would have rather had a narrower field with less distortion, but it works for me. I went ahead and gave 5 stars for "easy to install" even though it was a pain. But I don't think the issues I had could have been avoided in any way by the camera manufacturer. It was plug and play.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Connected it to an older Lenovo PC. It works great. It has nice resolution. Exceeded my expectations for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars ALMOST easy setup
reviews.reviewText: I am totally new to this type of product, so I chose this one on the basis of other reviews, the price, and the privacy cap. It arrived very quickly. I will say I was disappointed in the shipping - the camera was shipped in a padded envelope, which seemed pretty risky!I put it on top of my desktop monitor and plugged it in. It has a little red light when it is plugged in. At first, that light blinked, and when I looked at hardware setup, my computer didn't see it. I had used an unpowered USB hub. When I switched to a USB port directly on the computer, the light came on steadily. I have since gotten a powered USB hub (powered by a wall wart, that is) and it works fine with that. Lesson - this needs more power than a hub that draws power from the computer can provide.Then I Googled "webcam testing" and tried a couple of sites, neither of which saw it. The second site I tried, however, provided some advice, and I was able to change my privacy settings and then it worked. I also had to change the privacy settings for the mic.Then I scheduled a test Zoom meeting with my brother, who told me that the picture was clear and the sound good, and there were no issues when I moved toward or away from the camera, the picture remained clear. I was concerned that it wouldn't be able to focus except in a limited area because it does not have auto-focus, but that didn't seem to be the case. He said the picture was equally clear for items behind me in the room as for me.I will say - the perch on top of my monitor seemed very iffy. It just sits up there and you fold the back part which is supposed to apply tension to hold it on the monitor. It didn't feel secure, and I move my monitor around quite a bit on its arm. So I put a bit of Velcro on the monitor and on the camera and now it is secure, but still removable.The little tripod seems like a waste of space, but I'm not discarding it. Perhaps if I'm trying to demonstrate some kind of craft, it will come in handy.So I'm pretty happy with it. There are more expensive cameras with more bells and whistles, but this works for my purposes. Taking a full point off seems a bit harsh - but the instructions were really poor and I never would have gotten it set up if not for info from the Internet, not specific to this camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My grandson likes it for on line videos

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cam great, Mic not so great
reviews.reviewText: Set up was very easy, plug in play.. but the mic is HORRIBLE. No matter what I tried I can not get it to sound good when talking to people. Id have to be very close to the mic but then the only thing people will see on video is my nostrils! Not good for meeting with clients! I will have to return it and find another option.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I recommend this camera!
reviews.reviewText: Perfect size, easy to install, excellent picture and great quality! Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars microphone doesn't work
reviews.reviewText: Microphone doesn't work correctly. Initially, challenging set up with teleconference apps and eventually would not work on any app or computer despite adjusting settings, permissions and the green microphone light working. Good picture quality but unrealizable and unusable due to microphone issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent HD Webcam / Microphone Combo Value
reviews.reviewText: Needed a HD webcam / mic for conducting computer training classes on Zoom. The Hrayzan for under $50 met all my expectations and has performed reliably for over a month. To install on Windows, just plug it in to a USB port - no drivers needed. It works great on Zoom. The automatic exposure adjustment is great; it compensates for suboptimal lighting. The HD makes my image much sharper for other participants. The USB cable is about 3 feet long, but that's plenty for mounting the camera on top of my desktop monitor. The stereo microphone is quite powerful, on Zoom I've set the volume level to about 25% and I'm still loud enough for others to hear.My only ding is that the 110 degree viewing angle causes some spherical distortion at the edges of the image. That doesn't affect video-conferencing, but might impact still photos or videos taken with the webcam.Since I only do web conferences about twice a week, when I'm not using the camera, I unplug it from the USB port to minimize the chance of being viewed or listened to by an external hacker.I'd definitely recommend this webcam.

I do Zoom meetings on a daily basis, and this webcam is just awesome! I have been using it for 2 weeks, it works great. It is really easy to be placed on the top of my monitor, and it does not have a spring or clipper that you don't have to worry about aging or damaging your monitor. When I use it on a Zoom meeting, the video quality is there and it focuses on me really well. Definitely recommend. Keep it up.
Does what it says and does it well both on my mac and my work pc.

It is an excellent USB webcam for the price. It is small and has a low weight, and It didn't need to install some drivers; the computer automatically detected it.I highly recommended it because it has a perfect picture quality, clear sound and stylish. It works great.

For the money it is great. Picture is good. I bought it for a friend so that he and I can do business meetings. So I get to see the product in action. I have the model up from this that is double the price. The biggest different is sound quality. The microphone in the model up is much better. This one is good... like a decent lap top. The picture is good too. Mine is a bit sharper but it does not that big of a difference. So for everyday use this is great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple and easy to set up and use
reviews.reviewText: I'm no expert on these techno toys - I just wanted a simple webcam to use on video conferencing(Zoom and Messenger) on my computer and I'm very pleased with it. No bells and whistles, but it does the trick for a good price. I just took it out of the box - plugged it into my PC USB port and was good to go.The picture is not super crisp - but in my case, that's a perk! :p
